intro: Koanophyllon consanguineum, commonly known as the Texas milkvetch, is a perennial flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Koanophyllon consanguineum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife in its native range.
